title: Security Engineer Interview Guide
description: Demonstrate security expertise across applications and infrastructure.

content.text: Security Engineer interviews assess your knowledge of security principles, threat modeling, and ability to secure systems across the stack. Expect technical deep dives, scenario-based questions, and discussions about security culture.

**What interviewers assess:**

- Security fundamentals and best practices
- Threat modeling and risk assessment
- Application and infrastructure security
- Incident response experience
- Security tooling and automation

**Typical security interview loop:**

1. **Recruiter screen** (30 min)
2. **Technical phone screen** (60 min) - Security concepts or coding
3. **Onsite/Virtual loop** (4-5 hours):
   - Security architecture/design round
   - Threat modeling exercise
   - Coding/automation round
   - Incident response scenario
   - Behavioral round
Security interviews often include 'How would you attack X?' questions. Show you can think like an attacker while maintaining ethical boundaries.

items.text: Review OWASP Top 10 and common vulnerabilities
Brush up on networking and cryptography
Prepare incident response stories with lessons learned
Review the company's security posture if possible
